repository_info.description: ACI.dev is the open source platform for VibeOps and infrastructure that connects your AI agents to 600+ tool integrations with multi-tenant auth, granular permissions, and access through direct functi

issues.title: Typescript SDK
issues.body:
### Required Pre-requisites

- [x] I have read the [Documentation](https://www.aci.dev/docs)
- [x] I have searched the [Issue Tracker](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/issues) and [Discussions](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/discussions) that this hasn't been reported yet.
- [ ] Consider asking in [Discussions](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/discussions) first

### Motivation

As we know most of the web application development used to happen in JS/TS so it will be great to have a TS sdk enabling so many more developers to integrate this library. I see other libraries like composio also does that.

Also nowadays so many good agent frameworks are coming in TS also, one such example is [mastra.ai](https://mastra.ai), similarly another one under works by inngest and few more are there. So it makes even more sense. 

Just for selfish interest I am already using mastra and building out a prod app which could use these tools in future üòÑ 

### Proposed Solution

Building out a TS sdk similar to python
issues.author: bhupesh-sf

Yeah, this has been on our radar, but we haven‚Äôt had a chance to prioritize it yet. We‚Äôll likely put it back on the table soon, though we can‚Äôt promise an ETA.
On a side note, if you‚Äôre open to contributing, feel free to reach out to us on Discord! An

issues.title: Support retrieving Notion page content (block-level data)
issues.body:
### Required Pre-requisites

- [x] I have read the [Documentation](https://www.aci.dev/docs)
- [x] I have searched the [Issue Tracker](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/issues)
- [x] I have searched the [apps directory](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/tree/main/backend/apps) to see if this integration already exists

### App Name

Notion

### Function Name

get_page_content

### API Docs Link

https://developers.notion.com/docs/getting-started

### Additional Context

Currently, the NOTION__GET_PAGE function only returns metadata about a Notion page and does not provide access to the actual content.

We are considering two potential approaches for implementation:

`NOTION__GET_BLOCK`
A function that directly fetches block data from a given block ID or page ID. This gives users access to the full Notion block structure (including nested blocks, formatting, etc.), but may be verbose, especially for large pages.

`NOTION__GET_PAGE_CONTENT`
A higher-level function that returns just the text content and key metadata from all blocks in a given page. Need implement it through connector function.
issues.author: jiwei-aipolabs

issues.title: Integration Request: Google Meet Support
issues.body:
### Required Pre-requisites

- [x] I have read the [Documentation](https://www.aci.dev/docs)
- [x] I have searched the [Issue Tracker](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/issues)
- [x] I have searched the [apps directory](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/tree/main/backend/apps) to see if this integration already exists

### App Name

Google Meet

### Function Name

schedule_meeting, get_meeting_record

### API Docs Link

https://developers.google.com/workspace/meet/api/reference/rest/v2

### Additional Context

Please add integration support for Google Meet, Google's widely-used video communication service. Integrating Google Meet would enable AI agents built with ACI.dev to manage and interact with video meetings programmatically, streamlining scheduling and coordination tasks in a structured, secure, and scalable way within the ACI framework.


Integrating Google Meet would allow AI agents to:

* Schedule new Google Meet meetings, generating unique meeting links.
* Retrieve details about scheduled meetings (e.g., time, participants, join link).
* Retrieve meeting note of scheduled meeting
issues.author: jiwei-aipolabs

issues.title: UX Improvement for Selecting Existing Linked Account Owner IDs
issues.body:
### Required Pre-requisites

- [x] I have read the [Documentation](https://www.aci.dev/docs)
- [x] I have searched the [Issue Tracker](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/issues) and [Discussions](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/discussions) that this hasn't been reported yet.
- [x] Consider asking in [Discussions](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/discussions) first

### Motivation

Motivation:

Currently, when configuring a linked account and associating it with an existing Linked Account Owner ID, users are required to manually input the identifier.

This manual input process presents two challenges:

- Users must remember or locate the exact identifier they previously created.
- As the number of Linked Account Owner IDs grows, management becomes increasingly complex and error-prone (e.g., typos, misidentification).

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9b943a44-aef1-474a-8975-cbabfaa34ffb)


### Proposed Solution

Proposed solution:

Introduce a dropdown selection UI that:

- Displays all existing Linked Account Owner IDs.
- Allows users to select an ID from a list instead of typing.
issues.author: JamieOgun

issues.title: Replace react-json-view due to React 19 compatibility issues
issues.body:
### Required Pre-requisites

- [x] I have read the [Documentation](https://www.aci.dev/docs)
- [x] I have searched the [Issue Tracker](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/issues) and [Discussions](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/discussions) that this hasn't been reported yet.
- [x] Consider asking in [Discussions](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/discussions) first

### Description



### **Description:**

In the current setup, the project uses `react-json-view` version 1.21.3. However, this library is not fully compatible with React 19, leading to potential issues in the application.

---

### **Expected behavior:**

* Identify and integrate an alternative JSON viewer component that is compatible with React 19.
* Ensure the new component provides similar or improved functionality (e.g., expand/collapse, formatting, optional editing).

---

### **Actual behavior:**

* `react-json-view`  does not support react 19

---


### Additional context

_No response_
issues.author: tianlilei-c

issues.title: integration: add support for create_page for notion
issues.body:
### Required Pre-requisites

- [x] I have read the [Documentation](https://www.aci.dev/docs)
- [x] I have searched the [Issue Tracker](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/issues)
- [x] I have searched the [apps directory](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/tree/main/backend/apps) to see if this integration already exists

### App Name

Notion

### Function Name

create_page

### API Docs Link

https://developers.notion.com/reference/post-page

### Additional Context

Please add write function support for Notion within the ACI.dev connector

Currently, the integration only supports read operations, which limits the ability of AI agents to fully interact with Notion workspaces. Adding support for write functions, especially CREATE_PAGE, is essential to unlock dynamic content creation capabilities.

Purpose: Allow AI agents to create new pages in a specified Notion database.

Markdown Support: The function should support Markdown-formatted input, which will be saved into the Notion page content (children blocks).
issues.author: jiwei-aipolabs

issues.title: Add a script in aci-mcp to easily install our MCP servers in Cursor, Claude desktop, etc
issues.body:
### Required Pre-requisites

- [x] I have read the [Documentation](https://www.aci.dev/docs)
- [x] I have searched the [Issue Tracker](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/issues) and [Discussions](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/discussions) that this hasn't been reported yet.
- [x] Consider asking in [Discussions](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/discussions) first

### Motivation

Right now if users want to use our MCP server, they have to edit the JSON configs for each client (Cursor, Claude, etc), which can be tedious, especially the users will also need to replace the API key place holder with their actual API key.

### Proposed Solution

Many MCP servers today just provides a convenient command that can be run on the terminal to install those MCP server. We should do the same. 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0df8f46f-6738-4a5e-8168-8cfd51210e1a)

issues.title: Log instruction filter related info for analytics
issues.body:
### Required Pre-requisites

- [x] I have read the [Documentation](https://www.aci.dev/docs)
- [x] I have searched the [Issue Tracker](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/issues) and [Discussions](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/discussions) that this hasn't been reported yet.
- [x] Consider asking in [Discussions](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/discussions) first

### Motivation

The custom instructions feature allows users to define in natural language what actions are allowed/prohibited for LLM calling a function on our platform.

For example, an user can create a "Work Assistant" agent that can use the app "Gmail". They can specify in the agent custom instruction for Gmail that this agent can only read any work related emails (e.g. by specifying a list of allowed email senders or a list of disallowed ones).

This feature allows more granular level of access control than the one provided by OAuth apps. For example, when you allow the scope of read email for Gmail, then the access token can read any email without restriction. With custom instructions, you can specify more granular levels of access control like the example I mentioned above.

In this issue, we want to add more logging for this feature so we can analyze and further enhance this feature.



### Proposed Solution

Add more logging around the custom instructions feature. Please discuss in the issue first before implementing it.
issues.author: dev-aipolabs

issues.title: Integration Request: Daytona.io API Support
issues.body:
### Required Pre-requisites

- [x] I have read the [Documentation](https://www.aci.dev/docs)
- [x] I have searched the [Issue Tracker](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/issues)
- [x] I have searched the [apps directory](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/tree/main/backend/apps) to see if this integration already exists

### App Name

Daytona.io

### Function Name

start_workspace, execute_command

### API Docs Link

https://www.daytona.io/docs/tools/api/

### Additional Context

### Motivation
Please add integration support for [Daytona.io](https://www.daytona.io/), a secure and elastic infrastructure platform designed for running AI-generated code. Daytona provides containerized, reproducible, and scalable environments, making it an ideal backend for AI agent systems that need to execute code safely and consistently.

### Proposed Solution
Integrating Daytona.io‚Äôs API would enable AI agents to:

- Create, start, stop, and manage secure code execution environments (workspaces).
- Upload, edit, and execute files or shell commands in isolated containers.
- Automate organization tasks like user roles, invitations, and quotas.

This would support safe, scalable AI-generated code execution, which is ideal for dev assistants, code agents, and sandboxed testing workflows.

issues.title: Use TanStack Query to cache requests
issues.body:
### Required Pre-requisites

- [x] I have read the [Documentation](https://www.aci.dev/docs)
- [x] I have searched the [Issue Tracker](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/issues) and [Discussions](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/discussions) that this hasn't been reported yet.
- [x] Consider asking in [Discussions](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/discussions) first

### Motivation

Right now, a lot of duplicate requests are made in different pages of the dev portal. Users have to wait for things to load all the time.

### Proposed Solution

Use TanStack query to manage all the API requests and cache them.

issues.title: Support OAuth2 authentication scheme for Figma
issues.body:
### Required Pre-requisites

- [x] I have read the [Documentation](https://www.aci.dev/docs)
- [x] I have searched the [Issue Tracker](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/issues)
- [x] I have searched the [apps directory](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/tree/main/backend/apps) to see if this integration already exists

### App Name

Figma

### Function Name

N/A

### API Docs Link

https://www.figma.com/developers/api#oauth2

### Additional Context

The current integrated Figma app on aci.dev only supports `api_key` based authentication scheme.
But some users want to automate the end-user onboarding process (without asking end user to get Figma api key as many of them are not very technical).
In this case `OAuth2` seems like a better authentication flow which Figma happen to also support.

issues.body:
### Required Pre-requisites

### Proposed Solution

Let's display the app icons in front of each app name to improve UI/UX.

issues.title: Integration Request: More functions for Figma
issues.body:

Figma

### Function Name

GET_COMMENTS_IN_A_FILE, GET_STYLE, GET_VERSIONS_OF_A_FILE, GET_ACTIVITY_LOGS, GET_IMAGE_FILLS, GET_COMPONENT, GET_FILE_COMPONENT_SETS

### API Docs Link

https://www.figma.com/developers/api

### Additional Context

The listed functions would make Figma app integration even more useful, as it would allow access to a more complete set of data, including user interactions with files and importantly the progression/versioning of the data.

issues.title: Integration Request: Trello Support
issues.body:
### Required Pre-requisites

- [x] I have read the [Documentation](https://www.aci.dev/docs)
- [x] I have searched the [Issue Tracker](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/issues) and [Discussions](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/discussions) that this hasn't been reported yet.
- [x] Consider asking in [Discussions](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/discussions) first

### Motivation

Please add integration support for Trello, the widely used project and task management tool. This will enable AI agents built with ACI.dev to interact with Trello boards, cards, and lists in a structured, secure, and scalable way.



### Proposed Solution

Integrating Trello would allow AI agents to:

Create, update, archive, or delete Trello cards and lists.

Fetch and summarize board content.

Automate project workflows and task assignments.

Sync tasks between Trello and other tools like Notion, Slack, or Google Sheets.

This is especially useful for personal assistant bots, team productivity agents, and task-syncing applications.
issues.author: rayyush

issues.title: Improve the UI/UX for modifying the allowed apps for an agent
issues.body:
### Required Pre-requisites

- [x] I have read the [Documentation](https://www.aci.dev/docs)
- [x] I have searched the [Issue Tracker](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/issues) and [Discussions](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/discussions) that this hasn't been reported yet.
- [ ] Consider asking in [Discussions](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/discussions) first

### Motivation

Right now the UI is a bit difficult to use. The area showing allowed apps is very small and hard to see. The color is also not obvious. 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/43f5b3f2-349c-4a3f-8fc2-cefea2acd6ad)

### Proposed Solution

I propose we use a data table to show all the apps, with a checkbox for each app. Kinda like the following:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d46fd375-c7f9-42b0-95dd-5bd5fb4591aa)

This table should support:

- [ ] Using the checkboxes to select individual apps to allow
- [ ] One click to select or deselect all apps
- [ ] A search bar to search for apps
- [ ] Sort apps by name
- [ ] Sort apps by checkbox status
issues.author: dev-aipolabs

comments.author: dev-aipolabs
comments.body: @tianlilei-c Could you help with this?

issues.title: Create Agent form should let users selected what apps to enable
issues.body:
### Required Pre-requisites

- [x] I have read the [Documentation](https://www.aci.dev/docs)
- [x] I have searched the [Issue Tracker](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/issues) and [Discussions](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/discussions) that this hasn't been reported yet.
- [ ] Consider asking in [Discussions](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/discussions) first

### Motivation

Right now when users create an agent, they can only specify the name and description of that agent. And then they need to find that agent in the agent list, click `Edit Allowed Apps` to configure what apps are allowed to be used by this agent, which is inconvenient.

### Proposed Solution

I propose that, in the create agent form, we add a table of apps configured for the current project, and then users can just easily check off the apps they want to use this agent when creating the agent. No more extra configuration.
issues.author: dev-aipolabs

issues.title: Multi-tenant Support in Unified MCP Server
issues.body:
### Required Pre-requisites

- [x] I have read the [Documentation](https://www.aci.dev/docs)
- [x] I have searched the [Issue Tracker](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/issues) and [Discussions](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/discussions) that this hasn't been reported yet.
- [x] Consider asking in [Discussions](https://github.com/aipotheosis-labs/aci/discussions) first

### Motivation

The current MCP servers (both Unified and App) require `--linked-account-owner-id` during startup. 
Even tho ACI.dev is designed to support multi-tenant/multi-user, this compromise was made due to the native support of multi-tenant of MCP (and due to the fact that most mainstream MCP clients like Cursor is not very flexible on what you can pass on to MCP servers).

### Proposed Solution

There are a few workaround we can take to solve this problem, without causing issues to existing users and mainstream MCP clients.

1. (Preferred) We just allow MCP clients/users to pass additional parameters for ACI_EXECUTE_FUNCTION. Currently the schema only has "intent" property and that's what the LLM will generate. But MCP clients/users can do some post processing after getting the tool call decision from LLM and inject "linked_account_owner_id" 

2. We provide a non standard interface "set_owner_id(id)"  (in additional to list_tools(), call_tool()), which your MCP client can call to set the owner id before calling ACI_EXECUTE_FUNCTION.

3. We provide another meta function ACI_SET_OWNER_ID, which your MCP client can call with the standard call_tool().  But note that your probably want to call this statically/deterministically instead of relying on LLM to generate the function call and it's argument (the owner_id).
issues.author: thisisfixer
